content: I ran across this 2017 paper investigating how long it took for issues to be fixed comparing Firefox's old slow release cycles versus their rapid release cycles: https://ctreude.files.wordpress.com/2017/11/emse17b.pdf Might be interesting to some here.
Did you get it from ‚ÄúIt never works in theory‚Äù, too? üòä

Yea! :smile: I like to follow Greg Wilson's work (he recently posted a book he wrote here: https://buildtogether.tech/ which I found interesting). I'm pretty dubious about most software engineering studies, but I still find it interesting to read them.
I like to think his selection before posting there is already a decent filter
